title: ion-nav
body: Nav is a standalone component for loading arbitrary components and pushing new components on to the stack.

Unlike Router Outlet, Nav is not tied to a particular router. This means that if we load a Nav component, and push other components to the stack, they will not affect the app's overall router. This fits use cases where you could have a modal, which needs its own sub-navigation, without making it tied to the apps URL.

props.name: animated
props.docs: If true, the nav should animate the transition of components.

props.name: animation
props.docs: By default ion-nav animates transition between pages based in the mode (ios or material design). However, this property allows to create custom transition using AnimateBuilder functions.

props.name: root
props.type: Function | HTMLElement | ViewController | null | string | undefined

props.name: swipeGesture
props.docs: If the nav component should allow for swipe-to-go-back.

methods.name: canGoBack
methods.docs: Returns true if the current view can go back.

methods.name: getByIndex
methods.docs: Get the view at the specified index.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: index The index of the view.

methods.name: insert
methods.signature: insert<T extends NavComponent>(insertIndex: number, component: T, componentProps?: ComponentProps<T> | null | undefined, opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Inserts a component into the navigation stack at the specified index. This is useful to add a component at any point in the navigation stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: insertIndex The index to insert the component at in the stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: component The component to insert into the navigation stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: componentProps Any properties of the component.

methods.name: insertPages
methods.signature: insertPages(insertIndex: number, insertComponents: NavComponent[], opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Inserts an array of components into the navigation stack at the specified index. The last component in the array will become instantiated as a view, and animate in to become the active view.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: insertIndex The index to insert the components at in the stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: insertComponents The components to insert into the navigation stack.

methods.name: pop
methods.signature: pop(opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Pop a component off of the navigation stack. Navigates back from the current component.

methods.name: popTo
methods.signature: popTo(indexOrViewCtrl: number | ViewController, opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Pop to a specific index in the navigation stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: indexOrViewCtrl The index or view controller to pop to.

methods.name: popToRoot
methods.signature: popToRoot(opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Navigate back to the root of the stack, no matter how far back that is.

methods.name: push
methods.signature: push<T extends NavComponent>(component: T, componentProps?: ComponentProps<T> | null | undefined, opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Push a new component onto the current navigation stack. Pass any additional information along as an object. This additional information is accessible through NavParams.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: component The component to push onto the navigation stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: componentProps Any properties of the component.

methods.name: removeIndex
methods.signature: removeIndex(startIndex: number, removeCount?: number, opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Removes a component from the navigation stack at the specified index.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: startIndex The number to begin removal at.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: removeCount The number of components to remove.

methods.name: setPages
methods.signature: setPages(views: any[], opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Set the views of the current navigation stack and navigate to the last view. By default animations are disabled, but they can be enabled by passing options to the navigation controller. Navigation parameters can also be passed to the individual pages in the array.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: views The list of views to set as the navigation stack.

methods.name: setRoot
methods.signature: setRoot<T extends NavComponent>(component: T, componentProps?: ComponentProps<T> | null | undefined, opts?: NavOptions | null | undefined, done?: TransitionDoneFn | undefined) => Promise<boolean>
methods.docs: Set the root for the current navigation stack to a component.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: component The component to set as the root of the navigation stack.

docsTags.name: param
docsTags.text: componentProps Any properties of the component.

docs:
Nav is a standalone component for loading arbitrary components and pushing new components on to the stack.

Unlike Router Outlet, Nav is not tied to a particular router. This means that if we load a Nav component, and push other components to the stack, they will not affect the app's overall router. This fits use cases where you could have a modal, which needs its own sub-navigation, without making it tied to the apps URL.

events.docs: Event fired when the nav has changed components
Event fired when the nav will change components
